available before calling it. If this returns false or reverts, only tokens are transferred to the receiver. If this returns true, tokens are transferred and ccipReceive is called atomically. ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,.details: Note ensure you check the msg.sender is the OffRampRouter

completeWithdrawal().details: The msg.sender will be used to load the withdraw request data if the request received the total amount requested from other pools, the withdraw will be finalize. If not, it must revert

handleOracleFulfillment(bytes32,bytes,by.details: Either response or error parameter will be set, but never both.

params.err: Aggregated error either from the request's source code or from the execution pipeline.
params.response: Aggregated response from the request's source code.

orchestratorLoan(address,uint256,address.details: only the Orchestrator contract should be able to call this functionfor ether transfer, the _receiver need to be known and trusted

params._receiver: address of the user that will receive the amount
params._token: address of the token being loaned

params._chainSelector: the CCIP chainSelector for the specific chain

setConceroContractSender(uint64,address,.details: only owner can call itit's payable to save some gas.this functions is used on ConceroPool.sol

params._contractAddress: address of the Cross-chains Concero contracts
params._isAllowed: 1 == allowed | Any other value == not allowed

params._newCap: The new Cap of the pool

setPoolsToSend(uint64,address).details: only owner can call itit's payable to save some gas.this functions is used on ConceroPool.sol

params._pool: address of the Cross-chain ConceroPool contract

params._lpAmount: the amount of lp token the user wants to burn to get USDC back.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Should indicate whether the contract implements IAny2EVMMessageReceiver e.g. return interfaceId == type(IAny2EVMMessageReceiver).interfaceId || interfaceId == type(IERC165).interfaceId This allows CCIP to check if ccipReceive is available before calling it. If this returns false or reverts, only tokens are transferred to the receiver. If this returns true, tokens are transferred and ccipReceive is called atomically. Additionally, if the receiver address does not have code associated with it at the time of execution (EXTCODESIZE returns 0), only tokens will be transferred.

returns._0: true if the interfaceId is supported

ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,.notice: Called by the Router to deliver a message. If this reverts, any token transfers also revert. The message will move to a FAILED state and become available for manual execution.

completeWithdrawal().notice: Function called to finalize the withdraw process.

depositLiquidity(uint256).notice: Function for user to deposit liquidity of allowed tokens

handleOracleFulfillment(bytes32,bytes,by.notice: Chainlink Functions response handler called by the Functions Router during fullilment from the designated transmitter node in an OCR round.

orchestratorLoan(address,uint256,address.notice: function to the Concero Orchestrator contract take loans

removePoolsFromListOfSenders(uint64).notice: Function to remove Cross-chain address disapproving transfers

s_contractsToReceiveFrom(uint64,address).notice: Mapping to keep track of allowed pool senders

s_loansInUse().notice: variable to store the amount that will be temporary used by Chainlink Functions

s_maxDeposit().notice: variable to store the max value that can be deposited on this pool

s_pendingWithdrawRequests(address).notice: Mapping to keep track of Liquidity Providers withdraw requests

s_poolToSendTo(uint64).notice: Mapping to keep track of allowed pool receiver

s_requests(bytes32).notice: Mapping to keep track of Chainlink Functions requests

s_withdrawRequests().notice: variable to store the amount requested in withdraws

setConceroContractSender(uint64,address,.notice: function to manage the Cross-chains Concero contracts

setPoolCap(uint256).notice: Function to set the Cap of the Master pool.

setPoolsToSend(uint64,address).notice: function to manage the Cross-chain ConceroPool contracts

startWithdrawal(uint256).notice: Function to allow Liquidity Providers to start the Withdraw of their USDC deposited
